definition.@value: An embolisation without documented injury or harm occurs when a solid object within the venous or arterial circulation propagates to a distal location and becomes lodged there.

longDefinition.@value: The solid object could include a foreign body, such as a piece of equipment used to perform the surgery, or could include a piece of tissue dislodged during the procedure (such as atheroma or thrombus).

label.@value: Embolisation, as mode of injury or harm
Embolic phenomenon without documented injury or harm
Air embolism without documented injury or harm
Injection of air without injury or harm
